fields.description: Plugins 2.2-beta12 is much stricter on Modules that do not declare a key and fail validation, causing a {{PluginParseException}}. Previously this kind of failure would cause the plugin to completely fail to load, and not appear in the list of plugins. Now it creates an UnloadablePlugin instance in its place, which is preferable as it will display the fact to the user. Unfortunately the code that is constructing the plugin isn't passing in the correct key, using the jar name as the key instead. This causes the {{PluginVersionStore}} to fail which in turn causes JIRA to fail to load.
fields.summary: Plugins2.2-beta12 Some UnloadablePlugins don't have a correct key causing JIRA startup to fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16607].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 projects with their own individual field configuration.
#* 1 Project(source project) will have a field hidden(in this example we are using the 'Components') field.
# Create issue with a component set in the source project
# Move issue to the project where the 'Components' field is set to be hidden by the field configuration

h3. Expected Results
- The UX of the confirmation screen highlights clearly any potential loss of data from the existing issue.

h3. Actual Results
- The confirmation screen lists out field values that will be removed in the same fashion as those that have been mapped correctly and thus obscures the results to be confirmed.

Field value getting removed can be seen during the last step of the move operation.
- Single issue move:
!image.png|thumbnail!

- Bulk move:
!bulkMove.png|thumbnail!

Original Description:
{quote}
When a field is hidden in that target project that is not hidden in the source project, the field will be set to its default value upon the move. In this case the user is presented with the information "All fields can be moved" even though some information will be lost. For example, moving issues into a project where the component field is hidden will silently delete all the components. 
{quote}
fields.summary: The confirmation screen on moving issues does not highlight potential information loss clearly

fields.description:
Jira fails to create or comment on issues when using a Exchange Server 2007 with turkish locale. The logs will present an exception like:

{noformat}
JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 ERROR [service.services.mail.MailFetcherService] Create Issue/Comment Service - ...[...]: Exception: A4 BAD Command Argument Error. 11;
nested exception is:
com.sun.mail.iap.BadCommandException: A4 BAD Command Argument Error. 11
javax.mail.MessagingException: A4 BAD Command Argument Error. 11;
nested exception is:
com.sun.mail.iap.BadCommandException: A4 BAD Command Argument Error. 11
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.getHeader(IMAPMessage.java:624)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:175)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:56)
at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
{noformat}

The communication with exchange looks like: 

{noformat}
*  OK Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 IMAP4 service ready
...
  A4 FETCH 1 (BODY.PEEK[HEADER.FIELDS (Message-ID)])
  A4 BAD Command Argument Error. 11
  A5 NOOP
  A5 OK NOOP completed.
  A6 CLOSE
  A6 OK CLOSE completed.
  A7 LOGOUT
* BYE Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 IMAP4 server signing off.
  A7 OK LOGOUT completed.
{noformat}

This seems to be due to the problems converting the 'i' character in Turkish from upper case to lower case ([explanation|http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/turkish-i18n.html]). For instance, the following sequence fails:

{noformat}
-> 5 FETCH 1:* (BODY.PEEK[HEADER.FIELDS (Message-Id)])
<- 5 BAD Command Argument Error. 11
{noformat}

But with a non capital 'i' is succeeds:

{noformat}
-> 6 FETCH 1:* (BODY.PEEK[HEADER.FiELDS (Message-id)])
<- * ...
<- 6 OK FETCH completed.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Exchange with Turkish locale IMAP service

fields.description:
*+Steps to reproduce+*
# associate project A to workflow A, which has To Do, In Progress, and Done statuses
# associate project B to workflow B, which has Open, Reopened, In Progress, Resolved, and Closed statuses
# make sure status Resolved in workflow B requires a Resolution on the Resolve Issue screen
# create a new issue in project A, which should have status To Do
# move it to project B and select status Resolved

*+Expected behavior+*
Resolution field should be required to be filled in in the Update Fields step

*+Actual behavior+*
Resolution field is not required to be filled, resulting to the fact that the issue is Resolved without a Resolution

*+Original description+*
{quote}
When moving an issue to a context that does not contain the current status, you can select a new status. E.g. "Awaiting Review" -> "Resolved" 
This moves the issue into the resolved state, however the issue does not have a resolution. You need to re-open and then resolve it to be prompted for a resolution. 
As resolution is not a required field, this is not technically a bug but still can leave JIRA in an inconsistent state. A bit like not having the resolution field on a the resolve transition screen. 

This happens for move issue and convert to subtask/issue.
{quote}
fields.summary: Moving an issue to a resolved state can leave the resolution empty

fields.description:
This seems very similar to a bug I found listed under Confluence at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2487 .

JIRA does not handle attached text files encoded as ISO-8859-1 correctly. JIRA also translates the spaces in file names to + characters.

I attached a file called "Vorschlag Update - Ralf Ehrhard.txt" to a issue. The file is a text file with ISO-8859-1 encoding. The uploading worked perfectly. When clicking on the attachement (because it is a text file) my Firefox browser opened the file and rendered the text as UTF-8, replacing non-ASCII charachers with little 'diamond symbols'.

Trying to download the file, the file name became "Vorschlag+Update+-+Ralf+Ehrhard.txt". Once I opened the downloaded file from my local file system, the file rendered correctly again.

Inspecting the HTTP headers for the attachment, I found it to be
{code}
content-disposition: inline; filename*=UTF-8''Vorschlag+Update+-+Ralf+Ehrhard.txt;
Content-type: text/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Lenth: 1065
{code}
so the encoding of the file has not been honoured. Since we have users from all over the globe and multiple languages and encodings are being used, 
it is important that encodings can be honoured in some way. Would it be possible to have an edit functionality where a user can manually correct the encoding (dropdown set up by local administrator perhaps even?) or where JIRA at least correctly senses and records the encoding.
fields.summary: ISO-8859-1 is not honoured in attachments of text files and file names of attachements are changed.

fields.description:
When a transition is not available it should have the option of showing up greyed out with a mouse over text to show why it is not available.

So when you make something like the following to try and enforce people having to log time on a issue before it is resolved.  You end up with the "Resolve Issue" link not showing up as it did not meet the condition.   It would be very nice to have part of that "Group Condition" the option to still show the link but with a message saying why it is greyed out.

Then you win in most cases.  User can see that resolve is available just that the issue currently doesn't meet the requirements (or they don't).  And mouse over the "Resolve Issue" link and they will see WHY.   


Example Condition:

Conditions
Add a new condition to restrict when this transition can be performed.

Only users with Resolve Issues permission can execute this transition.
Add grouped condition | Edit | Delete
— AND    Add condition to group | Switch to OR
The field Time Spent will have to be not equal to value NULL . Compared like String .
Add grouped condition | Edit | Delete
fields.summary: When a transition is not available it should have the option of showing up greyed out with a mouse over text to show why it is not available

This should allow me to create appropriate reports for customers wanting to know e.g. how long we worked on an issue, how long we waited for customer to respond to questions etc.
fields.summary: Exporting Date/Timestamps of status changes for reporting purposes
Ability to fetch available options for custom fields from SOAP

fields.description:
What is the reason to clone issues? When you are too lazy to copy&paste strings from already created issue to the new one. Or when you have same task for various developers.
But you won't need to clone issue to have same person have 2 completely same issues.
So - I want to tell that you *always* edit issue after cloning. So why not to do following workflow:
istead of
# click "Clone"
# _create new issue_
# edit new issue
do
# click "Clone"
# edit new issue
# _create new issue_

Currently it is possible only to change issue title - why not to allow to edit all issue fields.
Another reason to do this - if you clone issue 5 times and then reassign clones to different developers - original issue owner will receive 5 email notifications that he has 5 new issues.
fields.summary: Go to "Edit" screen before creating cloned issue

fields.description:
JIRA allows you to set regular expressions to filter out particular URL patterns from TrackBack URLs.
However, the trackback library will still attempt HTTP communications with the given server while it gathers a list of all "potential" trackbacks.
It is only after this that the "potential" list is filtered down to remove the URLs configured to be ignored.

This has the following implications:
* Unnecessary and undesired network communications
* If the connection has errors, these errors are logged in JIRA, and the customer will get confused, thinking that the filter is not working.
fields.summary: JIRA attempts HTTP communications with URLs that are in the Trackback Filter.

fields.description:
On jira.atlassian.com:

# Click *Find Issues*
# Click the help icon next to the *Work Ratio* searcher

The help page you are taken to is this:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/issue_filters.html?clicked=jirahelp#workratio

{{issue_filters}} should be replaced with {{issue_search}} which actually contains the correct information:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/issue_search.html?clicked=jirahelp#workratio
fields.summary: Help link for Work Ratio searcher goes to wrong help page

At the bottom of the jelly page is this section (you can get there with [this link|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#inactivate]):

# filter5days is the id of a saved search (filter), which finds issues needing to be inactivated (transitioned). This ID can be discovered from the filter URL on the "Manage" tab in "Find issues".

fields.description:
Jed recently fix a number of memory related bugs in webwork1 trunk.  However he made the changes in 1.5 dialect.  We need to back port the changes to a 1.4 branch so 3.13.x can get them

This includes more logging a stack trace around the infamous

[webwork.view.taglib.IteratorTag] Value is null! Returning an empty set.
fields.summary: Backport Jeds webwork1 bug fixes to JDK 1.4

fields.description:
JIRA does not use the JESSIONID url encoding and requires that you have cookies in order to work.

However when the webwork tag uses HttpResonse.encodeURL() to encode the jessionid ito the URl if need be.  That need be situation is whenever a person logs on for the first time.

This generates invalid URL in JIRA all over the place.

We need to decide whether to fix it in the the webwork url tag or in the 200 odd places we have that are using the url tag wrongly.

My gut feel is to fix it in the web work tag itself since we do want the behavior in the first place.
fields.summary: Take out URL encode from WebWork URL tag so that we get rid of the jessionid= problem

fields.description:
The JIRA instance on jira.codehaus.org uses CAPTCHA for signup. Today I tried to help a user of GeoServer to open an account, we made soft of 15 attempts in a row, most of the time the image was not readable. Removing "circles" from the chars makes most of the time unreadable to a human too, as significant part of the char are not visible anymore.
Couple that with a few non matching passwords and you have a recipe for frustration.
fields.summary: CAPTCHA filters human and machines alike

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16558].
  {panel}

Hi, I use jira to manage issues or questions towards several companies (splitted into different sequrity levels). For each company there is several jira-users. som user are "tecnical experts" other works with the business or are more "functional experts".

I see it as a nice feature to be able to add a custom short description of every user when they are created and edited.
in the permission schema it should be possible to set who has access to read/add/change this description.

When holding the mouse over a username, a lable could then pop up over the mouse containing the description (using the title attribute in HTML).

In my case, this would resulted in better controll of all the users I am contacting every day in Jira. Somtimes I will report to tecnincal resources in a company, other times to funtional workers.

By the way, thanks for an excelent product :)
fields.summary: Add a short description of a Jira user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16557].
  {panel}

Hi
I see it as a great advantages if the assignee list could be grouped. E.g. by groups, security level or project roles.
I use jira to manage issues or questions towards several companies (splitted into different sequrity levels). For each company there is several jira-users. When I create an issue, or should assign a jira issue, it would be a great advantage for me to have the assignee list grouped.

Assignee:
Company_A
- user 1
- user 2
- user 3
Companty_B
- user 4
- user 5

I have serached for a plugins for this functionality, but havne't found any :(

If this will be implemented, as I see it, this should be setting pr. project. Project admin should be able to choose if th assignee list should be grouped by group, security level, project roles or not grouped.


An other solution would be to add security level to the first screen when creating an issue (together with project and issue type).
Then the assignee list on the 2nd screen should only contain users according to the security level set for the issue.
fields.summary: Group the Assignee list by group, security level or project roles
Keep "Next" and "Finish" buttons in the same location on pages that follow each other

fields.description:
Each company using Jira faces the problem from time to time: a user goes to vacation or goes sick, so some other person should process all issues where the absent user is assignee. Currently the only option is to find and process such issues by hand, re-assign them if necessary, change other custom fields, where the absent user is mentioned. It's not convenient.

I suggest Jira provides a way to assign a substitute for any user. For example, in the Users list there should be a field *Current substitute*, and if it is filled in, the given user is used anywhere in the algorithms (including plugins' in/out parameters) instead of the original one.
fields.summary: There should be a way for setting a substitute for a given assignee (user)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16550].
  {panel}

When accessing a Saved filter, you initially start with the full path 

e.g. http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=17379

This link will work regardless of what filter is in the session (if I've done a search in the backgrounde etc.). When I click on "Edit" it then resorts to pulling it from the session.

It'd be nice if both the "View" & "Edit" link retains full URL iff it has not be modified. That way it's possible to have a main tab of issues, do some throwaway background searches, come back too the main tab, and "Edit" still takes you to the relevent "Edit" link (rather than some search that you did and threw away on some other tab)

It doesn't work perfectly (not much you can do once the filter's edited, for example) but it's better than nudda.
fields.summary: Unmodified filter views should retain their full URL

2. See the snapshot for Jira 4.0(firefox 3.0), the boundary box for "Needs verification" is missing.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Startup JIRA with VM parameters {noformat}-Duser.language=de -Duser.country=DE{noformat}
# Ensure that English UK is set both as the global default and the current user's preferred language
# Observe as everything is still in German

We believe this is because there are no actual language files for en_UK and we rely on the default language bundle to be chosen in their absence, but somehow the JVM chooses the DE language bundle before considering the default one.

Furthermore, If you change the language to English US, *most things* will correctly translate to English, but some things still remain in German (Issue Types in the quick create section of Browse Project, for example).
fields.summary: English UK translation does not work when the VM locale is not English

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 139 Trunk)
2. Login as project admin and edit the project.
3. Click on "Image" next to Project avatar to edit the image.
4. Now suppose user was away from computer for 30 mins. when he/she comes back and tries to upload an image, its says not login and give a link to login.
5. Click on login link and a login window appear in that small window only.
6. User enters a valid userid/pwd.

Result:
1. User gets a system error. Complete log file attached.
2. I was not sure the issue belong to which area,as got with project avatar dialog will let Chris assign it to appropriate person.

Expected:
1. No error message should come and user should proceed with the work
fields.summary: User gets a system error if after timeout tries to login from project avatar dialog

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 139 Trunk)
2. Login as project admin and edit the project.
3. Click on "Image" next to Project avatar to edit the image.

Result:
1. One image is missing in the list of pre defined avatars.
2.  Error log file is attached

Expected:
1. All images should be present
fields.summary: Project avatar: One image is missing from "Choose an avatar" dialog

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 139 Trunk)
2. Login as project admin and click on "Edit project"
3. Try to upload a new project avatar by uploading JPEG/GIF/PNG files
 
Result:
1.The image file get uploaded when user tries to crop it, nothing happens
2. I am getting null pointer exception whe trying select the uncropped avatars sometime.

Expected:
1. User should be able to crop the image.
fields.summary: Project Avatars: User is unable to crop the uploaded image in the project avatars dialog

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 139 Trunk)
2. Login as project admin and edit the project.
3. Click on "Image" next to Project avatar to edit the image.
4. Try to upload a JPEG/PNG image.

Result:
1. It give error message "Errors
The file content you have provided is not a supported image format. Please try a JPEG, GIF or PNG file."
2. On Firefox you can upload the same image.

Expected:
1. User should be able to upload the image.
fields.summary: Project Avatars: User is unable to upload PNG and JPEG file for project avatars on IE 7.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16528].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 137 Trunk)
2. Click on "Group Browser" under Administration tab. Select a group having 10-15 members.
3. Click "Edit members", now open the "user picker" to select users.


Result:
1. It currentlyshow all the user in the system, means both user present/not present in the group.

Expected:
1. It should only show the user not present in the group.
2. From user usability point, this a major hindrance, by mistake if user select a user already present. User has to perform 1-2 steps more to remove the user and then add other members
fields.summary: User picker for group should show only those users which are not there in the group already

fields.description:
When selecting entities to be a "group" role member for a project, it is possible to select a user.

If you give an unknown name (neither user or group), an error is properly raised.
But if you give an existing user name for a group, JIRA accepts it as group role member and even propose to browse its member ! Really odd.
Of course, the role is not applied to that user inserted as a group.

I agree I may be tired when I have selected users in the group picker but the JIRA behavior is - let say - unexpected.

So the entity from the group picker should be validated before added as a group role,
and the "ViewGroup" action should also validate the "name" parameter.
fields.summary: Group/User pickers do not validate entities in Project Roles edition

fields.description: When we set the search criteria on the basis of assignee. We can select only one assignee. If we want to search issues which are assigned to more than one person, we cannot do that. One option is to select the option "Specify Group". But a group might have more than 2 members. So i want something like "Specify Users" where i can choose more than one assignee in a comma separated format. Like adding users to project roles. This would help a lot.
fields.summary: Searching according to multiple assignees should be provided.
